intro: Kuhnia hitchcockii, commonly known as the Hitchcock's kuhnia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, oval fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in open grasslands and along stream banks. Kuhnia hitchcockii is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
